Act5Scene8Part2.speaker: Malcolm
Act5Scene8Part2.text: I would the friends we miss were safe arrived.

Act5Scene8Part2.speaker: Siward
Act5Scene8Part2.text: Some must go off; and yet by these I see So great a day as this is cheaply bought.

Act5Scene8Part2.speaker: Malcolm
Act5Scene8Part2.text: Macduff is missing, and your noble son.

Act5Scene8Part2.speaker: Ross
Act5Scene8Part2.text: Your son, my lord, has paid a soldier’s debt.

Act5Scene8Part2.speaker: Ross
Act5Scene8Part2.text: Ay, and brought off the field.

Act5Scene8Part2.speaker: Siward
Act5Scene8Part2.text: Why then, God’s soldier be he!

Act5Scene8Part2.speaker: Malcolm
Act5Scene8Part2.text: He’s worth more sorrow, and that I’ll spend for him.

Act5Scene8Part2.speaker: Siward
Act5Scene8Part2.text: He’s worth no more. They say he parted well and paid his score.

Act5Scene8Part2.speaker: Macduff
Act5Scene8Part2.text: Hail, King! for so thou art. Behold where stands Th’ usurper’s cursèd head. The time is free. Hail, King of Scotland!

Act5Scene8Part2.speaker: Malcolm
Act5Scene8Part2.text: We shall not spend a large expense of time before we reckon with your several loves and make us even with you.

Act5Scene8Part2.speaker: Malcolm
Act5Scene8Part2.text: My thanes and kinsmen, henceforth be earls, the first that ever Scotland in such an honor named. What’s more to do, which would be planted newly with the time, So thanks to all at once and to each one, whom we invite to see us crowned at Scone.

Act5Scene8Part2.speaker: Malcolm
Act5Scene8Part2.text: What’s more to do, which would be planted newly with the time, So thanks to all at once and to each one, whom we invite to see us crowned at Scone.
